utterance: How can I register as a rider on QuickXMarket?
answer: To become a rider, you need to register on the Rider Portal or App, submit a valid ID, provide your own means of transportation, and attend a short onboarding session.

utterance: I want to join as a delivery rider, what's the process?
answer: You can sign up by registering on the Rider App or Portal, submitting a valid ID, and completing the short onboarding process.

utterance: What do I need to do to start working as a QuickXMarket rider?
answer: To become a rider, you need to register on the Rider Portal or App, submit a valid ID, provide your own means of transportation, and attend a short onboarding session.

utterance: Can anyone become a QuickXMarket delivery rider?
answer: You need to meet the rider requirements: valid ID, transportation, and complete onboarding.

utterance: How do I sign up to start delivering with QuickXMarket?
answer: Register on the Rider Portal or App, submit a valid ID, provide your own transportation, and complete onboarding.

utterance: What kind of orders will I be delivering as a rider?
answer: You may deliver food, groceries, personal essentials, and documents or parcels around campus.

utterance: As a rider, do I only deliver food or other items too?
answer: Deliveries usually include food, groceries, and sometimes parcels or documents.

utterance: What items will riders be responsible for delivering?
answer: You may deliver food, groceries, personal essentials, and documents or parcels around campus.

utterance: Will I deliver anything other than food?
answer: Yes, deliveries can include groceries, personal essentials, and parcels.

utterance: Do riders deliver documents as well?
answer: Yes, you may occasionally deliver documents along with food and groceries.

utterance: How do I get assigned orders as a rider?
answer: Deliveries are assigned based on your proximity to pickup, availability, and your delivery rating. You'll get a notification and can accept or reject it in the app.

utterance: Who decides which orders I'll deliver?
answer: Orders are assigned automatically based on your location, online status, and performance history.

utterance: How are delivery tasks distributed to riders?
answer: Assignments are based on distance to pickup, online status, and rider ratings.

utterance: Will I get to choose my orders?
answer: You can accept or decline orders, but frequent declines may affect priority and bonuses.

utterance: Are delivery tasks automatic for riders?
answer: Yes, the system automatically assigns deliveries based on proximity, availability, and ratings.

utterance: What are the working hours for riders?
answer: You can work flexible hours. The platform operates from 8 AM to 9 PM, Monday to Sunday. You log in and out when you like.

utterance: When can I log in to start working as a rider?
answer: You choose your own hours, as long as you work within 8 AM to 9 PM.

utterance: Can I work any time I want as a rider?
answer: Yes, you can work flexible hours, within platform operation times of 8 AM to 9 PM.

utterance: Are there fixed shifts for riders?
answer: No, riders can log in and out according to their schedule within operating hours.

utterance: What times does QuickXMarket accept deliveries from riders?
answer: Deliveries are handled between 8 AM and 9 PM; riders can work flexibly within this timeframe.

utterance: How much can I make as a QuickXMarket rider?
answer: Riders earn per delivery. Earnings depend on distance, order volume, and bonuses. Payouts are made 1 working day after request.

utterance: What's the rider pay structure like?
answer: Earnings vary depending on distance, time, and order volume, plus bonuses during peak hours.

utterance: How do riders get paid?
answer: Payments are made 1 working day after request via bank transfer or wallet.

utterance: Do riders earn extra for busy hours?
answer: Yes, bonuses are available during peak demand or special campaigns.

utterance: Is rider pay per delivery or hourly?
answer: Riders earn per delivery, with additional bonuses in some cases.

utterance: Do riders get bonuses or incentives?
answer: Yes! You can earn bonuses for high ratings, referrals, peak-hour work, or completing many deliveries.

utterance: What should I wear while riding?
answer: Wear clean, comfortable clothing. If given, use QuickXMarket-branded bags or gear for visibility and hygiene.

utterance: What should I do if I can't finish a delivery?
answer: Contact Rider Support immediately via the app or helpline and explain the reason. Never abandon or hand over the order without permission.

utterance: What if the customer doesn't pick my calls?
answer: Wait 5 minutes at the drop-off, try contacting them, then reach out to support. The item may be returned or held at a pickup point.

utterance: What if the order is damaged or incomplete?
answer: If an item is missing, damaged, or incorrect, notify support immediately and don't tamper with the package.

utterance: Do I need a driver's license to be a rider?
answer: QuickXMarket doesn't require insurance, but you're responsible for your own safety. Follow traffic rules and provide documentation if asked.

utterance: Can I reject deliveries I don't want to take?
answer: Yes, you can accept or decline, but rejecting too many may affect bonuses and priority status.

utterance: How can I see my ratings and earnings?
answer: You can view delivery history, earnings, and customer ratings directly in the Rider App.

utterance: Who do I contact if I have an issue as a rider?
answer: For help with orders, payment, or technical issues, contact Rider Support via email, phone, or in-app chat (8 AM â€“ 9 PM).
